title: Diazo Print, "Design for Printed Textile-Plusses, Series #705", 1959
medium: Blueprint on off-white wove paper, graphite
inscribed: Imprinted annotation at upper center: Half FULL SIZE REPEAT/ 24" and below pattern at left: NOTE:/ PLUSSES ARE TO BE COLOR PRINTED / SERIES #705 "PLUSSES"; imprinted signature lower right below pattern: ALEXANDER GIRARD 2/4/59
provenance: This collection was donated to the Cooper-Hewitt, National Design Museum in 1969 by Alexander Girard
description: The object is in two parts; the first design consists of three horizontal rows of "plus signs" [+]  imprinted in blueprint. A second blueprint is fstened to the first with two staples at left side. The design consists of several pieces of "Plusses" pattern glued to the paper.

tombstone.epitaph: Diazo Print, "Design for Printed Textile-Plusses, Series #705", 1959.Blueprint on off-white wove paper, graphite. Gift of Alexander H. Girard. 1969-165-286.
